definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He introduced me to his housekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 他把我介绍给他的女管家。

sentences.english: The masseuse was let in by a housekeeper, who then knocked on the door of Ledger's bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 按摩师由一位女管家领着，来到莱杰卧室的门外敲门。

sentences.english: Her father soon married their housekeeper and had more children.
sentences.chinese: 不久，她的父亲就娶了女管家，生了更多孩子。

sentences.english: He introduced me to his housekeeper .
sentences.chinese: 他把我介绍给他的女管家。

sentences.english: You'd better ring for the housekeeper to bring more soap.
sentences.chinese: 你最好按铃叫女管家再拿点肥皂来。

sentences.english: Then he looked at the housekeeper and a dreadful suspicion filled his
sentences.chinese: 他看着女管家，突然一种可怕的怀疑闯进了他的脑际。

sentences.english: I am sure your housekeeper is not really Dorothy.
sentences.chinese: 你们的女管家决不会是多萝西。

sentences.english: The housekeeper bowed very low in gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 女管家满怀感激地深深鞠了一个躬。

sentences.english: But the housekeeper lingered by the door, and the basket stayed shut.
sentences.chinese: 可这时女管家却一个劲地在门外徘徊，提篮也紧闭着。

sentences.english: I knew she had been the housekeeper there since Hindley's death.
sentences.chinese: 我知道亨德雷死后她就成了这儿的女管家。

definition: young lady of the house/wife of the young master
